intro: Actinea linearifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved actinia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sedges. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial shade. Actinea linearifolia is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
